TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and is currently serving a sentence of CARDINAL imprisonment . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by PERSON and PERSON , former ORG and former acting Representative of GPE at ORG respectively .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE the applicant was arrested on suspicion of rape and remanded in custody .
On DATE the ORG convicted the applicant of rape and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment .

On DATE the applicant was transferred to correctional colony IKCARDINAL of ORG , LOC ( ORG ИК-CARDINAL PERSON по PERSON области ) to serve his sentence . The parties submitted the following accounts of conditions in IKCARDINAL .

The applicant was held in units nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the correctional colony . On several occasions he was also held in punishment units nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the disciplinary unit .

Unit no . CARDINAL was a dormitory which measured QUANTITY m , including a sleeping area of CARDINAL sq . m , a canteen and a sanitary unit . Unit no . CARDINAL was a dormitory measuring QUANTITY m and including a sleeping area of CARDINAL sq . m , a canteen , a washroom and a toilet . Unit no . CARDINAL housed from CARDINAL inmates , and unit no . CARDINAL housed from CARDINAL inmates . During the daytime the applicant could move freely within the unit ’s local zone .

Punishment units nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL measured CARDINAL and QUANTITY . m respectively . They housed respectively CARDINAL inmates including the applicant . Since the applicant was engaged in labour he spent most of the day outside the unit . He could also take TIME outside walks after work .

The windows of the punishment units measured CARDINAL by QUANTITY , and the windows of the dormitories measured CARDINAL by QUANTITY They were not covered with metal blinds and had no other arrangements preventing the access of daylight .
All premises were equipped with CARDINAL filament lamps and CARDINAL security lights .
The punishment units , bathhouse and canteen were equipped with natural and extractor ventilation . The sleeping areas of the units had natural ventilation .
All premises were sufficiently heated . The average temperature in the sleeping areas of the units was maintained at QUANTITY , and in the punishment units at QUANTITY .

The punishment units were equipped with lavatories separated from the living area by QUANTITY . The dormitories were equipped with lavatory rooms equipped with cold and hot water taps and lavatory booths separated from one another by QUANTITY .
The applicant had at all times been provided with an individual bed and bedding ( a mattress , a blanket , a pillow , CARDINAL bed sheets and a pillow slip ) .

The applicant could take a shower once DATE . He was given food in accordance with the established norms . The quality of the food was monitored on a regular basis by the medical staff of the facility . The applicant could receive food parcels from relatives and buy food at the facility ’s shop .
The punishment units were equipped with dining tables and benches , and the dormitories had canteens where the inmates took their meals .
Regular disinfections and disinfestations were carried out in the facility .

Punishment unit no . CARDINAL was half the size indicated by the Government and housed CARDINAL inmates . Unit no . CARDINAL was shared by CARDINAL inmates . The artificial lighting in the colony ’s LOC was insufficient and often non - existent on account of electricity cuts . The heating was also insufficient . There was no ventilation . The dimensions of the windows indicated by the Government were incorrect . There were no hot water taps in the facility . The food was of poor quality and inadequate in quantity . The bedding was never changed .
On DATE the applicant requested the police to secure his property during his pre - trial detention . On DATE he made the same request to the court .
The court established the following .

The applicant did not indicate any particular individual or legal entity to be entrusted with securing his property . He further refused to have the property secured on a commercial basis . The police made a considerable effort to find a person who would be in the best position to secure the applicant ’s property . In particular , they contacted the applicant ’s brother , the municipal maintenance company and persons identified as P. , PERSON and NORP , but for various reasons the attempts proved unsuccessful .
As a result , on DATE , the applicant ’s property and belongings were entrusted to ORG , a person who lived in the applicant ’s flat with the applicant ’s permission .
Later PERSON disappeared , and the prosecutor ’s office failed to discover his whereabouts .

On an unspecified date the applicant informed the police of his other belongings located in different places . However , the applicant did not provide any documents certifying that he was the owner of the belongings in question . The court established , however , that a person identified as Zh . agreed to keep the applicant ’s car . NORP provided a list of the applicant ’s belongings which were kept at her place , and the applicant did not object to the above persons being left in charge of his belongings .
The final decision was given by ORG on DATE .
